summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Experian Information Solutions, Inc., dated August 16, 2019, commanding the production of credit reports and related documents pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking and related offenses, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena specifically requests all credit reports, fraud alerts, and related documents pertaining to her, indicating she is a central subject of the grand jury investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for Experian
events.description: The subpoena commands Experian Information Solutions, Inc. to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce documents, though personal appearance is waived if records are produced to the FBI by this date.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to Experian as part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies, including violations of federal sex trafficking statutes.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Experian Information Solutions, Inc., 701 Experian Parkway, Allen, TX 75013
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office)
keyFacts: A federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York was actively investigating suspected felonies, including violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy), as of August 2019.
The subpoena specifically targeted Ghislaine Maxwell's financial footprint, seeking all her credit reports, fraud alerts, accounts, addresses, and identifying information from Experian.

The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested Experian not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation and prevent interference.
The document demonstrates the investigative method of using financial records subpoenas to gather evidence on key figures in the Epstein-related investigation.
